file_content.text: I'm still here, Lieutenant.
I'm right behind you, Lieutenant.
Hey, Lieutenant, could you hold up a second?
I was wondering whether or not you had heard any of the rumors--about Taris, I mean.
No, I don't know anything about Taris.
What have you heard, Jorgan?
I don't waste my time with rumors.
They can be pretty hard to avoid.
I knew some guys on Ord Mantell who served here. They told crazy stories--weird cultists, monsters living in the swamps, that kind of thing.
Sounds like a fun place.
Tell me about it. These guys said Ord Mantell was a vacation compared to Taris.
Let's watch our step, then.
You never know how much of it is true, but something really spooked those guys.
I hope you don't actually believe stuff like that.
Aww, is little Jorgan afraid of monsters?
Please. You think I buy that scrag?
Still, I have a feeling our time here won't be a picnic.
And to think, Taris used to have cities that rivaled Coruscant. Back before the Sith bombarded every square inch of the planet from orbit, of course.
That is absolutely terrible!
You've got to be kidding me.
You didn't know? It happened centuries ago, now, but still--it's the kind of thing people remember.
Were there any survivors?
Negative. Total annihilation--every standing structure was destroyed. Now the place is nothing but swamps, jungles and ruins.
Just one more Sith atrocity.
Just one more thing the Sith are going to pay for.
I still don't get how Tavus and the others could willingly join up with the Empire, knowing that they're capable of things like this.
Ah, enough talk. We should probably get moving.
Agreed--time to move out.
Thanks for the heads up, Jorgan.
No problem, Lieutenant. Lead the way.
Let's go earn our pay.
I'll follow your lead, Lieutenant.
Yeah, I've heard enough out of you for one day.
You want to chat, get a friend--I'm just your CO.
Fine, then. Lead the way. Sir.
